channel.title: Help putting up personal Web client - not a noob
channel.description:
hello gentlemen, I have much experience with moparscape server compilation and content, and I have worked with many machine hosted servers and clients. I have always wanted to make my server have a web client like the main server [moparscape3.php]. so I decided to throw up a new page on my webserver, the html contains a simple applet launching code <applet name=webclient-test width=505 height=345 archive='experiemental/moparscape/web.jar' code='org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient.class' mayscript></applet> I have personally signed jarfile web.jar, so signing should not be a problem. when I attempt to load I recieve Classnotfoundexeption error message: org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient.class this should not be happening, im staring at mudclient.class now. however, I am currently operating on about 2 hours of sleep, so if the problem is flamingly simple pardon my ignorance :P Thank you for reading ~jaydin
also- current host is Windows- my normal environment is Linux, but i am certain windows is properly configured despite windows inexperience- it could be because I need to somehow integrate apache ant into my server. im fairly sure that thats dependent on clientside- not serverside apache ant. server is mongoose win64

item.title: Help putting up personal Web client - not a noob
item.dc:creator: @GNUd00d GNUd00d
item.description:
@GNUd00d wrote:

hello gentlemen,
I have much experience with moparscape server compilation and content, and I have worked with many machine hosted servers and clients. I have always wanted to make my server have a web client like the main server [moparscape3.php]. so I decided to throw up a new page on my webserver, the html contains a simple applet launching code
I have personally signed jarfile web.jar, so signing should not be a problem. when I attempt to load I recieve Classnotfoundexeption error message: org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient.class
this should not be happening, im staring at mudclient.class now. however, I am currently operating on about 2 hours of sleep, so if the problem is flamingly simple pardon my ignorance
Thank you for reading
~jaydin

also- current host is Windows- my normal environment is Linux, but i am certain windows is properly configured despite windows inexperience- it could be because I need to somehow integrate apache ant into my server. im fairly sure that thats dependent on clientside- not serverside apache ant.
server is mongoose win64
